summary: This documentary explores the potential evolution and impact of Facebook through a collection of visions and insights from leading tech thinkers.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen that transitions to a blue screen displaying the text "brought to you by" in white letters. This is followed by another blue screen with the text "the future of facebook" in white letters. The next frame shows a white screen with the same text "the future of facebook" in blue letters, accompanied by a list of topics: "Society," "Technology," "Economics," "Environment," and "Politics." The video then shifts to a blue screen with the number "1" and curly braces, followed by the text "Facebook will become fully integrated into the networked fabric of our lives" in white letters. The scene changes to a person wearing a gray sweater over a white shirt, standing in a room with a white ceiling and walls, and framed pictures on the wall. The text "Alex Howard, Govt 2.0 Correspondent, O'Reilly Media" appears at the bottom of the screen. The video continues with the same person speaking, with the background remaining consistent. The video concludes with a blue screen displaying the text "facebook.com/futureoffacebook" in white letters.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with soft, melodic instrumental music, creating a pensive mood. A male voice then begins to speak in a thoughtful tone, discussing Facebook becoming a more pervasive part of the "network fabric" of our lives and interacting with government, citizens, and businesses. The music fades into the background as the man continues to speak about the evolving value of "likes." The music fades out entirely as the man concludes his statement.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue screen displaying the number "2" and the text "Facebook will become the DASHBOARD for life." (Facebook will become the dashboard for life). The scene transitions to a man wearing glasses and a gray sweater, standing in front of a wall adorned with various posters, including one with the word "cake" and another featuring a person on a skateboard. The text "Eghosa Omoigui, Venture Capital & Private Equity" appears at the bottom of the screen. The man speaks, and the camera captures his expressions and gestures. The video then shifts to another man wearing a red beanie and a dark jacket, with earphones around his neck, standing in a room with wooden beams and shelves in the background. The text "Fred Wilson, Angel Investor" appears at the bottom of the screen. The man speaks, and the camera focuses on his expressions and gestures. The video concludes with a blue screen displaying the text "The Facebook Effect" and the URL "www.facebook.com/facebookeffect."
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a man speaking in a thoughtful tone, envisioning Facebook as a series of tabs for everything in one's life by 2015, allowing users to "search there," "buy there," and even manage their relationships. He concludes that it will become the "dashboard for life." Another man speaks next, in a similar analytical tone, discussing Facebook's potential role in presenting a "public persona" that is bland and palatable, unlikely to draw ill will. A subtle, melancholic instrumental piece plays in the background, featuring minimalist piano, strings, and percussion, maintaining a somber tone throughout both spoken sections.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a red beanie and a dark jacket, sitting in a room with wooden beams on the ceiling and shelves filled with various items in the background. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his hands are clasped together in front of him. The scene then transitions to a blue screen with white text that reads "YOUTH CULTURE will reject the 'mall' of FACEBOOK," indicating a thematic statement about the rejection of Facebook by youth culture. Following this, the video shifts to another man in a light blue shirt, seated in a room with bookshelves, framed artwork, and a floor lamp in the background. He is also speaking, as indicated by his mouth movements and hand gestures. The video continues with this man, maintaining the same setting and attire, as he continues to speak, with the background remaining consistent throughout. The video concludes with the same man in the light blue shirt, still speaking in the same room, with no significant changes in the environment or his actions.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning "a dozen other apps" and young people "defecting" to them, suggesting someone will become an older demographic. The speaker predicts Facebook will wane, expressing it may be exhausting rather than energizing. After a brief moment of quiet, the speaker adds that Facebook may be seen as the establishment, and youth will seek to get "beyond American Idol," indicating an exodus from sales-oriented services. A mellow instrumental piece featuring a keyboard plays, providing a sense of reflection. The track creates an understated backdrop, underscoring the speaker's contemplations on the topic.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a series of individuals speaking in different settings, each with a distinct background. The first person is seated in a room with bookshelves, a framed picture, and a lamp, wearing a light blue shirt. The scene transitions to a blue screen displaying the number '5' followed by curly braces. Next, a person in a dark zip-up sweater appears in a room with a bookshelf and a window with blinds, identified as Scott Smith, founder of Changeist, through on-screen text. The video continues with Scott Smith speaking, maintaining the same background and attire. The final scene shows another individual in a room with a bookshelf and a window, wearing a dark jacket and glasses, with a blue border on the left side of the frame. Throughout the video, the focus remains on the speakers and their surroundings, with minimal changes in their positions or actions.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating a concept is "just a matter of time, it's just a cycle." A simple, mellow melody is played with string instruments, creating a pensive mood. Another male speaker discusses how something will ultimately "peak" in terms of online capacity and user draw. He continues by describing how complex and contextual the online communication or value will be, suggesting the expansion into the offline world is critical for survival.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing glasses and a black zip-up sweater, seated in a room with a bookshelf filled with books and a window with blinds in the background. The scene transitions to a blue screen with white text that reads, "FACEBOOK will need to fend off SOCIAL NETWORKS that EMPOWER ENTREPRENEURS." The number "6" is prominently displayed on the left side of the screen, indicating a list or ranking. The video then shifts to a woman with long dark hair, wearing a gray top, seated in a room with a blue wall adorned with stars and a geometric patterned window. The text "Science House" appears in the lower left corner of the screen, suggesting the name of the organization or segment. The woman appears to be speaking, as her mouth moves and her facial expressions change throughout the frames. The video maintains a consistent focus on the woman, with no significant changes in the background or her position.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker discussing the possibility of a service "peaking at several hundred million users" and ultimately being "replaced by the next big thing" in a somewhat critical tone. The audio transitions to a female speaker who believes "the future lies in the creation of thriving small businesses," suggesting that "Facebook doesn't really offer a lot of opportunities." The clip concludes with a single word from an unknown speaker.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman with long dark hair, wearing a gray top, seated in front of a blue wall adorned with a geometric pattern and stars. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and facial expressions. The text overlay identifies her as Rita J King, EVP of Business Development at Science House. The scene transitions to a blue screen with white text that reads "Facebook will make groups SMARTER & could catalyze a global superorganism." The text is presented in a bold, sans-serif font, emphasizing the message about Facebook's potential impact on global connectivity and organization. The video maintains a professional and informative tone throughout, focusing on the woman's insights and the significance of the text message.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker discussing her vision for Facebook, focusing on "entrepreneurialism" and "mixed media, mixed reality events". She suggests integrating the physical world with the platform to generate revenue. Then, the clip transitions to music, with a pulsing electronic beat that creates an atmospheric, somewhat suspenseful, mood.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with various books and framed photographs. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his head slightly shifts position throughout the video. The background remains consistent, with the bookshelf and its contents providing a static backdrop. At one point, text appears on the screen identifying the man as "Nova Spivack, founder, Lucid Ventures." The lighting is even, and the overall atmosphere is calm and focused, suggesting an interview or a recorded conversation. The man's expressions and gestures indicate that he is engaged in a discussion or presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker discusses the human ability to join groups and think as groups, suggesting that Facebook could enable this and help people function more collectively, even towards group minds or collective consciousness. The speaker expresses a hopeful and optimistic tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, seated in front of a bookshelf filled with books and framed photographs. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his head slightly shifts position. The background is a well-organized bookshelf, suggesting a personal or professional study environment. The man's expressions and gestures indicate he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a speech. The video concludes with a solid blue screen, indicating a transition or end of the segment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with someone speaking in an optimistic tone about how connection and understanding can bring people closer and create a smarter human superorganism. There's gentle, atmospheric electronic music playing in the background, contributing to a hopeful mood. The speaker is a man. The clip concludes with the sounds of ambient music.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue background displaying the text "the future of facebook" in white, setting the theme for the content to follow. It transitions to a world map made up of the word "facebook" repeated across the continents, symbolizing the global reach of the platform. The scene then shifts to a Facebook profile page, showcasing a user's activity and interactions, emphasizing the social aspect of the platform. The video then moves to a blue background with the Facebook logo, followed by a gavel striking a block, suggesting legal or regulatory implications. The phrase "BIG BROTHER IS WATCHING" appears, hinting at surveillance concerns. The video concludes with a sign displaying "$1,1," possibly indicating a cost or value associated with the platform, leaving viewers to ponder the financial and privacy implications of Facebook's future.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single, female speaker with a neutral tone discussing Facebook's growth and challenges since a project began, including its global expansion, structural changes, and controversies like the Google Plus competition, credit experimentation, lawsuits over address book data, government surveillance, and preparation for a large IPO. There are no background sounds or music present.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue background featuring a white sign displaying "$100,000,000,000" in bold white text, indicating a significant monetary value. The scene transitions to a white background with blue human figures arranged in rows, accompanied by the text "ONE BILLION" in bold blue letters, emphasizing a large population or quantity. The figures are then shown in a more detailed and organized grid pattern, reinforcing the concept of a billion individuals. The video then shifts to a blue background with a white silhouette of a human head in profile, symbolizing thought or contemplation. The silhouette's head opens up, revealing a question mark above it, suggesting inquiry or uncertainty. The final frame displays the text "intentions & impact" in white letters above the head silhouette, with the head still open, indicating a focus on the relationship between intentions and their consequences. The video uses visual metaphors and text to convey themes of scale, human connection, and the importance of thoughtful consideration.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male voice introducing the topic of Facebook's socio-economic influence, speaking in a serious and informative tone. He urges the public to question the intentions and impact of Facebook and similar social structures. In the background, there is soft, unobtrusive music, possibly of an ambient or electronic style, contributing to a serious and thoughtful atmosphere.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue background featuring a white silhouette of a human head, which transitions to a white background displaying the text "the future of facebook" in blue. This is followed by a blue background with the logo and text "notribe collaborative innovation" in white. The video then lists various names and roles, such as "Video Designer / Animator / Editor Shane Valcich" and "Producers Charles Andretta II, Justin Chung, Debra Ferber," among others, all set against a blue background. The video concludes with the Facebook logo and the text "open foresight" and "An Open Foresight Project" in white on a blue background. The overall theme of the video appears to be related to the future of Facebook and collaborative innovation, with a focus on the contributors and projects involved.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker discussing open foresight methodology as open source and applicable to any future topic, encouraging collaborative vision building of our complex world. As the speech fades out, instrumental music begins, with a calm and reflective mood. The music prominently features synthesizer sounds. In the background, subtle ambient sounds are present, giving the impression of a modern, abstract environment.
